results.title: Blue Murder: Part 2
results.creator_credit: Michael Jenkins, Rod Allan, Southern Star Entertainment, Film Finance Corporation Australia and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Based on the events that led to the Royal Commission on Police Corruption in New South Wales, ‘Blue Murder’ is a riveting and exceptionally well executed thriller about police corruption and gangland criminal activity in 1980s Australia.
Richard Roxburgh is outstanding as Roger Rogerson, the larrikin police chief who built a lucrative ‘alternative’ career based on bribery, drug money and murder. Tony Martin is Neddy Smith, one of Australia’s most notorious underworld thugs.
Rogerson and Smith’s activities are threatened when a young police officer, Michael Drury (Steve Bastoni), declines a bribe offered to him by Rogerson. From that moment on, ‘Blue Murder’ depicts how Drury’s involvement in acting as an informer on Rogerson’s activities led to increasingly desperate and murderous acts by both police and crims.
Acclaimed internationally as a landmark television mini-series, ‘Blue Murder’ was for years unable to be screened in NSW or available for view on video in Australia due to elements of the story being seen as prejudicial to legal trials in NSW and Federal Courts.
Cast also inlcudes Alex Dimitriades, Peter Phelps and John Hargreaves.
First broadcast (outside NSW) September 21st, 1995.

results.title: Bruce Almighty
results.creator_credit: Jim Carrey, Tom Shadyac, Spyglass Entertainment and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Local tv reporter Bruce Nolan doesn’t think that the world is treating him fairly. Then, after the worst day ever, Bruce angrily rails against God for ruining his life and mismanaging the universe. So God responds and endows Bruce with all of his powers to see if he can do a better job. Cast includes Jim Carrey, Morgan Freeman, Jennifer Aniston, Philip Baker Hall, Catherine Bell.

constellations_other.name: Divining the divine
constellations_other.description: Depicting the Almighty in paintings was frowned upon in the early 1800s in Britain, much like it has been throughout the history of cinema, according to writer Scot Hughes, who made many of these connections in a 2003 article in the Sydney Morning Herald.

results.title: Pain, passion and profit
results.creator_credit: Gurinder Chadha, Gerard Rosenberg, BBC and International Broadcasting Trust
results.brief_description: Anita Roddick, founder and manager of Body Shop International visits Africa and looks at how women entrepreurs survive and flourish. In Kenya she investigates a successful women’s cooperative producing an efficient earthenware stove and in Ghana she looks at a food preservation business and a clothing industry, both managed by women.

results.title: The Adjuster
results.creator_credit: Atom Egoyan, Camelia Frieberg and Ego Film Arts
results.brief_description: Noah Render (Elias Koteas), is an insurance adjuster who plays saviour to vulnerable clients whose lives have been uprooted by tragedy. His wife Hera (Arsinee Khanjian), works as a film censor for the Canadian government and secretly videotapes extracts for her sister. Into their lives come Bubba and Mimi, a wealthy couple who spend money staging erotic fantasies to sustain their relationship. Posing as filmmakers, they use Noah and Hera’s home in the middle of a desolate housing estate as the setting for their latest and most dangerous immersion in playacting.

results.title: Visions of light
results.creator_credit: Todd McCarthy, Stuart Samuels, Arnold Glassman, Nihon Hoso Kyokai and American Film Institute
results.brief_description: The premise of this wonderfully engaging documentary is simple: sit a number of the world’s best cinematographers in front of a camera for a change, have them talk about their work on some of the enduring classics of world cinema, excerpt clips to illustrate what they are talking about, and ask them to cite some of their influences. What results is completely hypnotic, especially for anyone who knows anything about the movies and wants a glimpse of what goes into getting them made. This documentary will leave you wishing that it was at least twice as long!

results.title: Swoon
results.brief_description: Tom Kalin’s first feature is a stylish and challenging interpretation of the 1924 kidnapping and murder of a young boy by Chicago’s famous lovers Nathan Leopold and Richard Loeb. Although based on court transcripts and archival research, the fractured narrative and experimental format are utilized to question the mythology of the ‘pathological’ homosexual and to reorder history as it was reported.

results.title: Betty Blue = 37.2 Le Matin
results.creator_credit: Jean-Jacques Beineix, Claudie Ossard, Cargo Films and Constellation
results.brief_description: A contemporary tale of ‘amour fou’ based on the novel by Phillipe Djian, “Betty blue” is the story of Zorg (Jean-Hugues Anglade) who at 31 has accepted a certain measure of resignation, and the beautiful, passionate nineteen year old Betty (Beatrice Dalle), who dramatically enters his life and proceeds to dismantle his complacency with her volatile, urgent nature. Betty and Zorg’s life together is dominated by Betty’s fearless embracing of whatever emotion or new circumstance presents itself. This propels them both into a series of events and encounters by turns comic and poignant. Betty’s restlessness and her ever-worsening mental illness finds a focus in Zorg. She decides he is a brilliant writer and she sets about despatching his diaries to potential publishers. In the face of disappointment, however, Betty’s increasingly extreme reactions begin to reveal an instinct for self-destruction that Zorg is helpless to subdue. French language with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jean-Jacques Beineix, Claudie Ossard, Cargo Films and Constellation

results.title: Antarctica
results.creator_credit: Koreyoshi Kurahara, Koretsugu Kurahara, Masaru Kakutani, Kurahoa Productions, Gakken Company and Fuji Telecasting
results.brief_description: The year is 1958. The men of the first Japanese Antarctic expedition are expecting to be relieved by another party on board the ice breaker ‘Soya’. A fierce blizzard erupts and the ‘Soya’ is unable to reach base camp. A small plane is used to ferry the men of the first expedition back to the ice breaker. The men, believing the second party to be on its way, left behind fifteen sled dogs which were chained to posts embedded in ice. This is the incredible true story of these sled dogs and their struggle to survive an Antarctic winter. Narrated by Robert Wagner and music by Vangelis.

results.title: The Last Metro = Le Derniere Metro
results.creator_credit: Francois Truffaut, SFP, S A -TF1, SEDIF and Les Films Carrosse
results.brief_description: It is Paris, 1942, under the German Occupation, and successful Jewish theatrical director, Lucas Steiner, is forced into hiding. He entrusts the running of the theatre to his wife Marion, who must contend with Daxiat, a pro-Nazi critic. Masterful direction by Truffaut captures the climate of the occupation.
